node.title: Will it remain in red? Cabinet's 'traffic light' decision for Northland to be revealed
node.description: The Government will announce today whether Northland will remain at the red light.
node.content: ["By Sam Olley of RNZ", "The Government will announce on Thursday whether Northland will remain in the red setting of the COVID-19 'traffic light' system.", "Cabinet ministers met on Wednesday to decide whether it is tweaking the settings, with all regions at orange except Te Tai Tokerau/Northland.\u00a0", "Northland is also the only region that does not have at least 90 percent of people over 12 vaccinated.", "But as of Wednesday, it is now at 89 percent for first doses, just 1423 off the target.", "At red, gatherings at private properties are limited to 100 people. People need vaccine passes to enter hospitality venues and gyms.", "Northland Chamber of Commerce chief executive Steve Smith told RNZ being stuck in red had disheartened businesses.", "\"It's very unfortunate that we are so early in the year and we are already seeing that malaise of tiredness and stress coming back to the fore, even though many of us have had a holiday,\" Smith said.", "A move to orange was overdue, he said, and he disagreed with the Government's last decision to keep Te Tai Tokerau in red.", "\"To some extent, we have missed our seasonal peak, it's come and gone. There's still more of the summer left but of course, people's abilities to travel and have holidays are far more limited.\"", "Whang\u0101rei Mayor Sheryl Mai had less confidence in a traffic light change, knowing an Omicron outbreak was possibly imminent.", "\"This is the next big risk and employers - council for example - we're preparing for up to a quarter of our people to be away at any time. And of course, that has an impact on our ability to provide the services to our community,\" Mai said.", "\"I am pleased that I'm not one of the decision makers as to whether or not we move.\"", "The Prime Minister will make the traffic light announcement on Thursday afternoon.", "RNZ"]
